dialogos.dialogo: We've already seen how to define a Character in Ren'Py. But I want to go into a bit more detail as to what a Character is.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "We've already seen how to define a Character in Ren'Py. But I want to go into a bit more detail as to what a Character is."

dialogos.dialogo: Here are couple of additional characters.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Here are couple of additional characters."

dialogos.dialogo: Each statement creates a Character object, and gives it a single argument, a name. If the name is None, no name is displayed.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Each statement creates a Character object, and gives it a single argument, a name. If the name is None, no name is displayed."

dialogos.dialogo: This can be followed by named arguments that set properties of the character. A named argument is a property name, an equals sign, and a value.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "This can be followed by named arguments that set properties of the character. A named argument is a property name, an equals sign, and a value."

dialogos.dialogo: Multiple arguments should be separated with commas, like they are here. Let's see those characters in action.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Multiple arguments should be separated with commas, like they are here. Let's see those characters in action."

dialogos.dialogo: And I can speak in a whisper.
dialogos.texto_completo: e_whisper "And I can speak in a whisper."

dialogos.dialogo: This example shows how the name Character is a bit of a misnomer. Here, we have multiple Characters in use, but you see it as me speaking.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "This example shows how the name Character is a bit of a misnomer. Here, we have multiple Characters in use, but you see it as me speaking."

dialogos.dialogo: It's best to think of a Character as repesenting a name and style, rather than a single person.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "It's best to think of a Character as repesenting a name and style, rather than a single person."

dialogos.dialogo: There are a lot of properties that can be given to Characters, most of them prefixed styles.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "There are a lot of properties that can be given to Characters, most of them prefixed styles."

dialogos.dialogo: Properties beginning with window apply to the textbox, those with what apply to the the dialogue, and those with who to the name of Character speaking.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Properties beginning with window apply to the textbox, those with what apply to the the dialogue, and those with who to the name of Character speaking."

dialogos.dialogo: If you leave a prefix out, the style customizes the name of the speaker.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "If you leave a prefix out, the style customizes the name of the speaker."

dialogos.dialogo: There are quite a few different properties that can be set this way. Here are some of the most useful.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "There are quite a few different properties that can be set this way. Here are some of the most useful."

dialogos.dialogo: The window_background property sets the image that's used for the background of the textbox, which should be the same size as the default in gui/textbox.png.
dialogos.texto_completo: e1 "The window_background property sets the image that's used for the background of the textbox, which should be the same size as the default in gui/textbox.png."

dialogos.dialogo: If it's set to None, the textbox has no background window.
dialogos.texto_completo: e1a "If it's set to None, the textbox has no background window."

dialogos.dialogo: The who_color and what_color properties set the color of the character's name and dialogue text, respectively.
dialogos.texto_completo: e2 "The who_color and what_color properties set the color of the character's name and dialogue text, respectively."

dialogos.dialogo: The colors are strings containing rgb hex codes, the same sort of colors understood by a web browser.
dialogos.texto_completo: e2 "The colors are strings containing rgb hex codes, the same sort of colors understood by a web browser."

dialogos.dialogo: Similarly, the who_font and what_font properties set the font used by the different kinds of text.
dialogos.texto_completo: e3 "Similarly, the who_font and what_font properties set the font used by the different kinds of text."
define e4 = Character("Eileen", who_bold=True, what_italic=True, what_size=20)

dialogos.dialogo: Setting the who_bold, what_italic, and what_size properties makes the name bold, and the dialogue text italic at a size of 20 pixels.
dialogos.texto_completo: e4 "Setting the who_bold, what_italic, and what_size properties makes the name bold, and the dialogue text italic at a size of 20 pixels."

dialogos.dialogo: Of course, the what_bold, who_italic and who_size properties also exist, even if they're not used here.
dialogos.texto_completo: e4 "Of course, the what_bold, who_italic and who_size properties also exist, even if they're not used here."

dialogos.dialogo: The what_outlines property puts an outline around the text.
dialogos.texto_completo: e5 "The what_outlines property puts an outline around the text."

dialogos.dialogo: It's a little complicated since it takes a list with a tuple in it, with the tuple being four things in parenthesis, and the list the square brackets around them.
dialogos.texto_completo: e5 "It's a little complicated since it takes a list with a tuple in it, with the tuple being four things in parenthesis, and the list the square brackets around them."

dialogos.dialogo: The first number is the size of the outline, in pixels. That's followed by a string giving the hex-code of the color of the outline, and the x and y offsets.
dialogos.texto_completo: e5 "The first number is the size of the outline, in pixels. That's followed by a string giving the hex-code of the color of the outline, and the x and y offsets."

dialogos.dialogo: When the outline size is 0 and the offsets are given, what_outlines can also act as a drop-shadow behind the text.
dialogos.texto_completo: e6 "When the outline size is 0 and the offsets are given, what_outlines can also act as a drop-shadow behind the text."
define e7 = Character("Eileen", what_xalign=0.5, what_textalign=0.5, what_layout='subtitle')

dialogos.dialogo: The what_xalign and what_textalign properties control the alignment of text, with 0.0 being left, 0.5 being center, and 1.0 being right.
dialogos.texto_completo: e7 "The what_xalign and what_textalign properties control the alignment of text, with 0.0 being left, 0.5 being center, and 1.0 being right."

dialogos.dialogo: The what_xalign property controls where all the text itself is placed within the textbox, while what_textalign controls where rows of text are placed relative to each other.
dialogos.texto_completo: e7 "The what_xalign property controls where all the text itself is placed within the textbox, while what_textalign controls where rows of text are placed relative to each other."

dialogos.dialogo: Generally you'll want to to set them both what_xalign and what_textalign to the same value.
dialogos.texto_completo: e7 "Generally you'll want to to set them both what_xalign and what_textalign to the same value."

dialogos.dialogo: Setting what_layout to 'subtitle' puts Ren'Py in subtitle mode, which tries to even out the length of every line of text in a block.
dialogos.texto_completo: e7 "Setting what_layout to 'subtitle' puts Ren'Py in subtitle mode, which tries to even out the length of every line of text in a block."

dialogos.dialogo: These properties can be combined to achieve many different effects.
dialogos.texto_completo: e8 "These properties can be combined to achieve many different effects."

dialogos.dialogo: This example hides the background and shows dialogue centered and outlined, as if the game is being subtitled.
dialogos.texto_completo: e8 "This example hides the background and shows dialogue centered and outlined, as if the game is being subtitled."

dialogos.dialogo: There are two interesting non-style properties, what_prefix and what_suffix. These can put text at the start and end of a line of dialogue.
dialogos.texto_completo: e9 "There are two interesting non-style properties, what_prefix and what_suffix. These can put text at the start and end of a line of dialogue."

dialogos.dialogo: By using kind, you can copy properties from one character to another, changing only what you need to.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "By using kind, you can copy properties from one character to another, changing only what you need to."

dialogos.dialogo: Like this! Finally I get some more dialogue around here.
dialogos.texto_completo: l8 "Like this! Finally I get some more dialogue around here."

dialogos.dialogo: The last thing you have to know is that there's a special character, narrator, that speaks narration. Got it?
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The last thing you have to know is that there's a special character, narrator, that speaks narration. Got it?"

dialogos.dialogo: Ren'Py has the concept of a displayable, which is something like an image that can be shown and hidden.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Ren'Py has the concept of a displayable, which is something like an image that can be shown and hidden."

dialogos.dialogo: The image statement is used to give an image name to a displayable. The easy way is to simply give an image filename.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The image statement is used to give an image name to a displayable. The easy way is to simply give an image filename."

dialogos.dialogo: But that's not the only thing that an image can refer to. When the string doesn't have a dot in it, Ren'Py interprets that as a reference to a second image.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "But that's not the only thing that an image can refer to. When the string doesn't have a dot in it, Ren'Py interprets that as a reference to a second image."

dialogos.dialogo: The string can also contain a color code, consisting of hexadecimal digits, just like the colors used by web browsers.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The string can also contain a color code, consisting of hexadecimal digits, just like the colors used by web browsers."

dialogos.dialogo: Three or six digit colors are opaque, containing red, green, and blue values. The four and eight digit versions append alpha, allowing translucent colors.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Three or six digit colors are opaque, containing red, green, and blue values. The four and eight digit versions append alpha, allowing translucent colors."
image logo rotated = Transform("logo base", rotate=45)

dialogos.dialogo: The Transform displayable takes a displayable and can apply transform properties to it.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The Transform displayable takes a displayable and can apply transform properties to it."

dialogos.dialogo: Notice how, since it takes a displayable, it can take another image. In fact, it can take any displayable defined here.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Notice how, since it takes a displayable, it can take another image. In fact, it can take any displayable defined here."

dialogos.dialogo: There's a more complete form of Solid, that can take style properties. This lets us change the size of the Solid, where normally it fills the screen.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "There's a more complete form of Solid, that can take style properties. This lets us change the size of the Solid, where normally it fills the screen."
image logo text = Text(_("This is a text displayable."), size=30)

dialogos.dialogo: The Text displayable lets Ren'Py treat text as if it was an image.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The Text displayable lets Ren'Py treat text as if it was an image."
image logo text rotate = Transform(Text(_("This is a text displayable."), size=30), rotate=45)

dialogos.dialogo: This means that we can apply other displayables, like Transform, to Text in the same way we do to images.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "This means that we can apply other displayables, like Transform, to Text in the same way we do to images."

dialogos.dialogo: The Composite displayable lets us group multiple displayables together into a single one, from bottom to top.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The Composite displayable lets us group multiple displayables together into a single one, from bottom to top."

dialogos.dialogo: Some displayables are often used to customize the Ren'Py interface, with the Frame displayable being one of them. The frame displayable takes another displayable, and the size of the left, top, right, and bottom borders.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Some displayables are often used to customize the Ren'Py interface, with the Frame displayable being one of them. The frame displayable takes another displayable, and the size of the left, top, right, and bottom borders."

dialogos.dialogo: The Frame displayable expands or shrinks to fit the area available to it. It does this by scaling the center in two dimensions and the sides in one, while keeping the corners the same size.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The Frame displayable expands or shrinks to fit the area available to it. It does this by scaling the center in two dimensions and the sides in one, while keeping the corners the same size."
image ninepatch frame tiled = Frame("ninepatch", 40, 40, 40, 40, tile=True)

dialogos.dialogo: A Frame can also tile sections of the displayable supplied to it, rather than scaling.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "A Frame can also tile sections of the displayable supplied to it, rather than scaling."
image ninepatch paper tiled = Frame("ninepatch paper", 40, 40, 40, 40, tile=True)

dialogos.dialogo: Frames might look a little weird in the abstract, but when used with a texture, you can see how we create scalable interface components.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Frames might look a little weird in the abstract, but when used with a texture, you can see how we create scalable interface components."

dialogos.dialogo: These are just the simplest displayables, the ones you'll use directly the most often.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "These are just the simplest displayables, the ones you'll use directly the most often."

dialogos.dialogo: You can even write custom displayables for minigames, if you're proficient at Python. But for many visual novels, these will be all you'll need.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "You can even write custom displayables for minigames, if you're proficient at Python. But for many visual novels, these will be all you'll need."

dialogos.dialogo: You may want to mix Ren'Py with other forms of gameplay. There are a couple of ways to do this.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "You may want to mix Ren'Py with other forms of gameplay. There are a couple of ways to do this."

dialogos.dialogo: The first is with the screen system, which can be used to display data and create button and menu based interfaces.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The first is with the screen system, which can be used to display data and create button and menu based interfaces."

dialogos.dialogo: Screens will work for many simulation-style games and RPGs.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Screens will work for many simulation-style games and RPGs."

dialogos.dialogo: When screens are not enough, you can write a creator-defined displayable to extend Ren'Py itself. A creator-defined displayable can process raw events and draw to the screen.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "When screens are not enough, you can write a creator-defined displayable to extend Ren'Py itself. A creator-defined displayable can process raw events and draw to the screen." id demo_minigame_a92baa6b

dialogos.dialogo: That makes it possible to create all kinds of minigames. Would you like to play some pong?
dialogos.texto_completo: e "That makes it possible to create all kinds of minigames. Would you like to play some pong?"

dialogos.dialogo: Would you like to play again?
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Would you like to play again?"

dialogos.dialogo: Here's the source code for the minigame. It's very complex, and assumes you understand Python well.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Here's the source code for the minigame. It's very complex, and assumes you understand Python well."

dialogos.dialogo: I won't go over it in detail here. You can read more about it in the {a=https://www.renpy.org/doc/html/udd.html}Creator-Defined Displayable documentation{/a}.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "I won't go over it in detail here. You can read more about it in the {a=https://www.renpy.org/doc/html/udd.html}Creator-Defined Displayable documentation{/a}."

dialogos.dialogo: Minigames can spice up your visual novel, but be careful – not every visual novel player wants to be good at arcade games.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Minigames can spice up your visual novel, but be careful – not every visual novel player wants to be good at arcade games."

dialogos.dialogo: Part of the reason Ren'Py works well is that it's meant for certain types of games, like visual novels and life simulations.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Part of the reason Ren'Py works well is that it's meant for certain types of games, like visual novels and life simulations."

dialogos.dialogo: The further afield you get from those games, the more you'll find yourself fighting Ren'Py. At some point, it makes sense to consider other engines.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The further afield you get from those games, the more you'll find yourself fighting Ren'Py. At some point, it makes sense to consider other engines."

dialogos.dialogo: And that's fine with us. We'll always be here for you when you're making visual novels.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "And that's fine with us. We'll always be here for you when you're making visual novels."

dialogos.dialogo: When you create a new project, Ren'Py will automatically create a GUI - a Graphical User Interface - for it.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "When you create a new project, Ren'Py will automatically create a GUI - a Graphical User Interface - for it."

dialogos.dialogo: It defines the look of both in-game interface, like this text box, and out-of-game interface like the main and game menus.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "It defines the look of both in-game interface, like this text box, and out-of-game interface like the main and game menus."

dialogos.dialogo: The default GUI is meant to be nice enough for a simple project. With a few small changes, it's what you're seeing in this game.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The default GUI is meant to be nice enough for a simple project. With a few small changes, it's what you're seeing in this game."

dialogos.dialogo: The GUI is also meant to be easy for an intermediate creator to customize. Customizing the GUI consists of changing the image files in the gui directory, and changing variables in gui.rpy.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The GUI is also meant to be easy for an intermediate creator to customize. Customizing the GUI consists of changing the image files in the gui directory, and changing variables in gui.rpy."

dialogos.dialogo: At the same time, even when customized, the default GUI might be too recognizable for an extremely polished game. That's why we've made it easy to totally replace.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "At the same time, even when customized, the default GUI might be too recognizable for an extremely polished game. That's why we've made it easy to totally replace."

dialogos.dialogo: We've put an extensive guide to customizing the GUI on the Ren'Py website. So if you want to learn more, visit the {a=https://www.renpy.org/doc/html/gui.html}GUI customization guide{/a}.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "We've put an extensive guide to customizing the GUI on the Ren'Py website. So if you want to learn more, visit the {a=https://www.renpy.org/doc/html/gui.html}GUI customization guide{/a}."

dialogos.dialogo: Ren'Py has a powerful style system that controls what displayables look like.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Ren'Py has a powerful style system that controls what displayables look like."

dialogos.dialogo: While the default GUI uses variables to provide styles with sensible defaults, if you're replacing the GUI or creating your own screens, you'll need to learn about styles yourself.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "While the default GUI uses variables to provide styles with sensible defaults, if you're replacing the GUI or creating your own screens, you'll need to learn about styles yourself."

dialogos.dialogo: What would you like to know about styles?
dialogos.texto_completo: e "What would you like to know about styles?"

dialogos.dialogo: Box, Grid, and Fixed style properties.
That's all I want to know.
Styles let a displayable look different from game to game, or even inside the same game.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Styles let a displayable look different from game to game, or even inside the same game."

dialogos.dialogo: Both of these buttons use the same displayables. But since different styles have been applied, the buttons look different from each other.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Both of these buttons use the same displayables. But since different styles have been applied, the buttons look different from each other."

dialogos.dialogo: Styles are a combination of information from four different places.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Styles are a combination of information from four different places."

dialogos.dialogo: The first place Ren'Py can get style information from is part of a screen. Each displayable created by a screen can take a style name and style properties.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The first place Ren'Py can get style information from is part of a screen. Each displayable created by a screen can take a style name and style properties."

dialogos.dialogo: When a screen displayable contains text, style properties prefixed with text_ apply to that text.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "When a screen displayable contains text, style properties prefixed with text_ apply to that text."
image style2 = Text(_("This text is colored red."), color="#ffc0c0")

dialogos.dialogo: The next is as part of a displayable created in an image statement. Style properties are just arguments to the displayable.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The next is as part of a displayable created in an image statement. Style properties are just arguments to the displayable."
define egreen = Character("Eileen", who_color="#c8ffc8", who_bold=True, what_color="#c8ffc8")

dialogos.dialogo: Style properties can also be given as arguments when defining a character.
dialogos.texto_completo: egreen "Style properties can also be given as arguments when defining a character."

dialogos.dialogo: Arguments beginning with who_ are style properties applied to the character's name, while those beginning with what_ are applied to the character's dialogue.
dialogos.texto_completo: egreen "Arguments beginning with who_ are style properties applied to the character's name, while those beginning with what_ are applied to the character's dialogue."

dialogos.dialogo: Style properties that don't have a prefix are also applied to the character's name.
dialogos.texto_completo: egreen "Style properties that don't have a prefix are also applied to the character's name."
image style3 = Text(_("This text is colored blue."), style="blue_text")

dialogos.dialogo: Finally, there is the the style statement, which creates or changes a named style. By giving Text the style argument, we tell it to use the blue_text style.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Finally, there is the the style statement, which creates or changes a named style. By giving Text the style argument, we tell it to use the blue_text style."

dialogos.dialogo: A style property can inherit from a parent. If a style property is not given in a style, it comes from the parent of that style.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "A style property can inherit from a parent. If a style property is not given in a style, it comes from the parent of that style."

dialogos.dialogo: By default the parent of the style has the same name, with the prefix up to the the first underscore removed. If the style does not have an underscore in its name, 'default' is used.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "By default the parent of the style has the same name, with the prefix up to the the first underscore removed. If the style does not have an underscore in its name, 'default' is used."

dialogos.dialogo: For example, blue_text inherits from text, which in turn inherits from default. The default style defines all properties, so it doesn't inherit from anything.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "For example, blue_text inherits from text, which in turn inherits from default. The default style defines all properties, so it doesn't inherit from anything."

dialogos.dialogo: The parent can be explicitly changed by giving the style statement an 'is' clause. In this case, we're explictly setting the style to the parent of text.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The parent can be explicitly changed by giving the style statement an 'is' clause. In this case, we're explictly setting the style to the parent of text."

dialogos.dialogo: Each displayable has a default style name. By default, it's usually the lower-case displayable name, like 'text' for Text, or 'button' for buttons.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Each displayable has a default style name. By default, it's usually the lower-case displayable name, like 'text' for Text, or 'button' for buttons."

dialogos.dialogo: In a screen, a displayable can be given the style_prefix property to give a prefix for that displayable and its children.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "In a screen, a displayable can be given the style_prefix property to give a prefix for that displayable and its children." id style_basics_35db9a05

dialogos.dialogo: For example, a text displayable with a style_prefix of 'help' will be given the style 'help_text'.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "For example, a text displayable with a style_prefix of 'help' will be given the style 'help_text'."

dialogos.dialogo: Lastly, when a displayable is a button, or inside a button, it can take style prefixes.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Lastly, when a displayable is a button, or inside a button, it can take style prefixes."

dialogos.dialogo: The prefixes idle_, hover_, and insensitive_ are used when the button is unfocused, focused, and unfocusable.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The prefixes idle_, hover_, and insensitive_ are used when the button is unfocused, focused, and unfocusable."

dialogos.dialogo: These can be preceded by selected_ to change how the button looks when it represents a selected value or screen.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "These can be preceded by selected_ to change how the button looks when it represents a selected value or screen."

dialogos.dialogo: This screen shows the style prefixes in action. You can click on a button to select it, or click outside to advance.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "This screen shows the style prefixes in action. You can click on a button to select it, or click outside to advance."

dialogos.dialogo: Those are the basics of styles. If GUI customization isn't enough for you, styles let you customize just about everything in Ren'Py.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Those are the basics of styles. If GUI customization isn't enough for you, styles let you customize just about everything in Ren'Py."

dialogos.dialogo: Orbiting Earth in the spaceship, I saw how beautiful our planet is.\n–Yuri Gagarin
dialogos.texto_completo: text _("Orbiting Earth in the spaceship, I saw how beautiful our planet is.\n–Yuri Gagarin")

dialogos.dialogo: The first group of style properties that we'll go over are the general style properties. These work with every displayable, or at least many different ones.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The first group of style properties that we'll go over are the general style properties. These work with every displayable, or at least many different ones."

dialogos.dialogo: Every displayable takes the position properties, which control where it can be placed on screen. Since I've already mentioned them, I won't repeat them here.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Every displayable takes the position properties, which control where it can be placed on screen. Since I've already mentioned them, I won't repeat them here."

dialogos.dialogo: The xmaximum and ymaximum properties set the maximum width and height of the displayable, respectively. This will cause Ren'Py to shrink things, if possible.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The xmaximum and ymaximum properties set the maximum width and height of the displayable, respectively. This will cause Ren'Py to shrink things, if possible."

dialogos.dialogo: Sometimes, the shrunken size will be smaller than the size given by xmaximum and ymaximum.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Sometimes, the shrunken size will be smaller than the size given by xmaximum and ymaximum."

dialogos.dialogo: Similarly, the xminimum and yminimum properties set the minimum width and height. If the displayable is smaller, Ren'Py will try to make it bigger.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Similarly, the xminimum and yminimum properties set the minimum width and height. If the displayable is smaller, Ren'Py will try to make it bigger."

dialogos.dialogo: The xsize and ysize properties set the minimum and maximum size to the same value, fixing the size.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The xsize and ysize properties set the minimum and maximum size to the same value, fixing the size."

dialogos.dialogo: These only works for displayables than can be resized. Some displayables, like images, can't be made bigger or smaller.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "These only works for displayables than can be resized. Some displayables, like images, can't be made bigger or smaller."

dialogos.dialogo: The area property takes a tuple - a parenthesis bounded list of four items. The first two give the position, and the second two the size.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The area property takes a tuple - a parenthesis bounded list of four items. The first two give the position, and the second two the size."
alt _("\"Orbiting Earth in the spaceship, I saw how beautiful our planet is.\" Said by Yuri Gagarin.")

dialogos.dialogo: Finally, the alt property changes the text used by self-voicing for the hearing impaired.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Finally, the alt property changes the text used by self-voicing for the hearing impaired."

dialogos.dialogo: Far better it is to dare mighty things, to win glorious triumphs, even though checkered by failure, than to rank with those poor spirits who neither enjoy nor suffer much, because they live in the gray twilight that knows not victory nor defeat.\n\n–Theodore Roosevelt
dialogos.texto_completo: text _("Far better it is to dare mighty things, to win glorious triumphs, even though checkered by failure, than to rank with those poor spirits who neither enjoy nor suffer much, because they live in the gray twilight that knows not victory nor defeat.\n\n–Theodore Roosevelt"):

dialogos.dialogo: The text style properties apply to text and input displayables.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The text style properties apply to text and input displayables."

dialogos.dialogo: Text displayables can be created implicitly or explicitly. For example, a textbutton creates a text displayable with a style ending in button_text.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Text displayables can be created implicitly or explicitly. For example, a textbutton creates a text displayable with a style ending in button_text."

dialogos.dialogo: These can also be set in gui.rpy by changing or defining variables with names like gui.button_text_size.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "These can also be set in gui.rpy by changing or defining variables with names like gui.button_text_size."

dialogos.dialogo: The bold style property makes the text bold. This can be done using an algorithm, rather than a different version of the font.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The bold style property makes the text bold. This can be done using an algorithm, rather than a different version of the font."

dialogos.dialogo: The color property changes the color of the text. It takes hex color codes, just like everything else in Ren'Py.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The color property changes the color of the text. It takes hex color codes, just like everything else in Ren'Py."

dialogos.dialogo: The first_indent style property determines how far the first line is indented.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The first_indent style property determines how far the first line is indented."

dialogos.dialogo: The font style property changes the font the text uses. Ren'Py takes TrueType and OpenType fonts, and you'll have to include the font file as part of your visual novel.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The font style property changes the font the text uses. Ren'Py takes TrueType and OpenType fonts, and you'll have to include the font file as part of your visual novel."

dialogos.dialogo: The size property changes the size of the text.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The size property changes the size of the text."

dialogos.dialogo: The italic property makes the text italic. Again, this is better done with a font, but for short amounts of text Ren'Py can do it for you.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The italic property makes the text italic. Again, this is better done with a font, but for short amounts of text Ren'Py can do it for you."

dialogos.dialogo: The justify property makes the text justified, lining all but the last line up on the left and the right side.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The justify property makes the text justified, lining all but the last line up on the left and the right side."

dialogos.dialogo: The kerning property kerns the text. When it's negative, characters are closer together. When positive, characters are farther apart.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The kerning property kerns the text. When it's negative, characters are closer together. When positive, characters are farther apart."

dialogos.dialogo: The line_leading and line_spacing properties put spacing before each line, and between lines, respectively.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The line_leading and line_spacing properties put spacing before each line, and between lines, respectively."

dialogos.dialogo: The outlines property puts outlines around text. This takes a list of tuples, which is a bit complicated.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The outlines property puts outlines around text. This takes a list of tuples, which is a bit complicated."

dialogos.dialogo: But if you ignore the brackets and parenthesis, you have the width of the outline, the color, and then horizontal and vertical offsets.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "But if you ignore the brackets and parenthesis, you have the width of the outline, the color, and then horizontal and vertical offsets."

dialogos.dialogo: The rest_indent property controls the indentation of lines after the first one.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The rest_indent property controls the indentation of lines after the first one."

dialogos.dialogo: The textalign property controls the positioning of multiple lines of text inside the text displayable. For example, 0.5 means centered.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The textalign property controls the positioning of multiple lines of text inside the text displayable. For example, 0.5 means centered." id style_text_430c1959

dialogos.dialogo: It doesn't change the position of the text displayable itself. For that, you'll often want to set the textalign and xalign to the same value.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "It doesn't change the position of the text displayable itself. For that, you'll often want to set the textalign and xalign to the same value." id style_text_19aa0833

dialogos.dialogo: When both textalign and xalign are set to 1.0, the text is properly right-justified.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "When both textalign and xalign are set to 1.0, the text is properly right-justified." id style_text_efc3c392

dialogos.dialogo: The underline property underlines the text.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The underline property underlines the text."

dialogos.dialogo: Those are the most common text style properties, but not the only ones. Here are a few more that you might need in special circumstances.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Those are the most common text style properties, but not the only ones. Here are a few more that you might need in special circumstances."

dialogos.dialogo: By default, text in Ren'Py is antialiased, to smooth the edges. The antialias property can turn that off, and make the text a little more jagged.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "By default, text in Ren'Py is antialiased, to smooth the edges. The antialias property can turn that off, and make the text a little more jagged."

dialogos.dialogo: The adjust_spacing property is a very subtle one, that only matters when a player resizes the window. When True, characters will be shifted a bit so the Text has the same relative spacing.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The adjust_spacing property is a very subtle one, that only matters when a player resizes the window. When True, characters will be shifted a bit so the Text has the same relative spacing."

dialogos.dialogo: When False, the text won't jump around as much. But it can be a little wider or narrower based on screen size.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "When False, the text won't jump around as much. But it can be a little wider or narrower based on screen size."

dialogos.dialogo: The layout property has a few special values that control where lines are broken. The 'nobreak' value disables line breaks entirely, making the text wider.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The layout property has a few special values that control where lines are broken. The 'nobreak' value disables line breaks entirely, making the text wider."

dialogos.dialogo: When the layout property is set to 'subtitle', the line breaking algorithm is changed to try to make all lines even in length, as subtitles usually are.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "When the layout property is set to 'subtitle', the line breaking algorithm is changed to try to make all lines even in length, as subtitles usually are."

dialogos.dialogo: The strikethrough property draws a line through the text. It seems pretty unlikely you'd want to use this one.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The strikethrough property draws a line through the text. It seems pretty unlikely you'd want to use this one."

dialogos.dialogo: The vertical style property places text in a vertical layout. It's meant for Asian languages with special fonts.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The vertical style property places text in a vertical layout. It's meant for Asian languages with special fonts."

dialogos.dialogo: And those are the text style properties. There might be a lot of them, but we want to give you a lot of control over how you present text to your players.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "And those are the text style properties. There might be a lot of them, but we want to give you a lot of control over how you present text to your players."

dialogos.dialogo: Next up, we have the window and button style properties. These apply to windows like the text window at the bottom of this screen and frames like the ones we show examples in.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Next up, we have the window and button style properties. These apply to windows like the text window at the bottom of this screen and frames like the ones we show examples in."

dialogos.dialogo: These properties also apply to buttons, in-game and out-of-game. To Ren'Py, a button is a window you can click.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "These properties also apply to buttons, in-game and out-of-game. To Ren'Py, a button is a window you can click."

dialogos.dialogo: I'll start off with this style, which everything will inherit from. To make our lives easier, it inherits from the default style, rather than the customized buttons in this game's GUI.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "I'll start off with this style, which everything will inherit from. To make our lives easier, it inherits from the default style, rather than the customized buttons in this game's GUI." id style_button_9b53ce93

dialogos.dialogo: The first style property is the background property. It adds a background to a button or window. Since this is a button, idle and hover variants choose different backgrounds when focused.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The first style property is the background property. It adds a background to a button or window. Since this is a button, idle and hover variants choose different backgrounds when focused." id style_button_aece4a8c

dialogos.dialogo: We also center the two buttons, using the xalign position property.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "We also center the two buttons, using the xalign position property."

dialogos.dialogo: We've also customized the style of the button's text, using this style. It centers the text and makes it change color when hovered.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "We've also customized the style of the button's text, using this style. It centers the text and makes it change color when hovered."

dialogos.dialogo: Without any padding around the text, the button looks odd. Ren'Py has padding properties that add space inside the button's background.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Without any padding around the text, the button looks odd. Ren'Py has padding properties that add space inside the button's background."

dialogos.dialogo: More commonly used are the xpadding and ypadding style properties, which add the same padding to the left and right, or the top and bottom, respectively.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "More commonly used are the xpadding and ypadding style properties, which add the same padding to the left and right, or the top and bottom, respectively."

dialogos.dialogo: The margin style properties work the same way, except they add space outside the background. The full set exists: left_margin, right_margin, top_margin, bottom_margin, xmargin, and ymargin.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The margin style properties work the same way, except they add space outside the background. The full set exists: left_margin, right_margin, top_margin, bottom_margin, xmargin, and ymargin."

dialogos.dialogo: The size_group style property takes a string. Ren'Py will make sure that all the windows or buttons with the same size_group string are the same size.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The size_group style property takes a string. Ren'Py will make sure that all the windows or buttons with the same size_group string are the same size."

dialogos.dialogo: Alternatively, the xfill and yfill style properties make a button take up all available space in the horizontal or vertical directions.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Alternatively, the xfill and yfill style properties make a button take up all available space in the horizontal or vertical directions."

dialogos.dialogo: The foreground property gives a displayable that is placed on top of the contents and background of the window or button.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The foreground property gives a displayable that is placed on top of the contents and background of the window or button."

dialogos.dialogo: One way to use it is to provide extra decorations to a button that's serving as a checkbox. Another would be to use it with a Frame to provide a glossy shine that overlays the button's contents.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "One way to use it is to provide extra decorations to a button that's serving as a checkbox. Another would be to use it with a Frame to provide a glossy shine that overlays the button's contents."

dialogos.dialogo: There are also a few style properties that only apply to buttons. The hover_sound and activate_sound properties play sound files when a button is focused and activated, respectively.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "There are also a few style properties that only apply to buttons. The hover_sound and activate_sound properties play sound files when a button is focused and activated, respectively."

dialogos.dialogo: Finally, the focus_mask property applies to partially transparent buttons. When it's set to True, only areas of the button that aren't transparent cause a button to focus.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Finally, the focus_mask property applies to partially transparent buttons. When it's set to True, only areas of the button that aren't transparent cause a button to focus."

dialogos.personaje: image bar empty idle vertical = Transform(
dialogos.texto_completo: image bar empty idle vertical = Transform("bar empty idle", rotate=90, rotate_pad=False)

dialogos.personaje: image bar empty hover vertical = Transform(
dialogos.texto_completo: image bar empty hover vertical = Transform("bar empty hover", rotate=90, rotate_pad=False)

dialogos.personaje: image bar full idle vertical = Transform(
dialogos.texto_completo: image bar full idle vertical = Transform("bar full idle", rotate=90, rotate_pad=False)

dialogos.personaje: image bar full hover vertical = Transform(
dialogos.texto_completo: image bar full hover vertical = Transform("bar full hover", rotate=90, rotate_pad=False)

dialogos.dialogo: To demonstrate styles, let me first show two of the images we'll be using. This is the image we're using for parts of the bar that are empty.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "To demonstrate styles, let me first show two of the images we'll be using. This is the image we're using for parts of the bar that are empty."

dialogos.dialogo: And here's what we use for parts of the bar that are full.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "And here's what we use for parts of the bar that are full."

dialogos.dialogo: The left_bar and right_bar style properties, and their hover variants, give displayables for the left and right side of the bar. By default, the value is shown on the left.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The left_bar and right_bar style properties, and their hover variants, give displayables for the left and right side of the bar. By default, the value is shown on the left."

dialogos.dialogo: Also by default, both the left and right displayables are rendered at the full width of the bar, and then cropped to the appropriate size.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Also by default, both the left and right displayables are rendered at the full width of the bar, and then cropped to the appropriate size."

dialogos.dialogo: We give the bar the ysize property to set how tall it is. We could also give it xsize to choose how wide, but here it's limited by the width of the frame it's in.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "We give the bar the ysize property to set how tall it is. We could also give it xsize to choose how wide, but here it's limited by the width of the frame it's in."

dialogos.dialogo: When the bar_invert style property is True, the bar value is displayed on the right side of the bar. The left_bar and right_bar displayables might also need to be swapped.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "When the bar_invert style property is True, the bar value is displayed on the right side of the bar. The left_bar and right_bar displayables might also need to be swapped."

dialogos.dialogo: The bar_resizing style property causes the bar images to be resized to represent the value, rather than being rendered at full size and cropped.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The bar_resizing style property causes the bar images to be resized to represent the value, rather than being rendered at full size and cropped."

dialogos.dialogo: The thumb style property gives a thumb image, that's placed based on the bar's value. In the case of a scrollbar, it's resized if possible.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The thumb style property gives a thumb image, that's placed based on the bar's value. In the case of a scrollbar, it's resized if possible." id style_bar_7d361bac

dialogos.dialogo: Here, we use it with the base_bar style property, which sets both bar images to the same displayable.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Here, we use it with the base_bar style property, which sets both bar images to the same displayable."

dialogos.dialogo: The left_gutter and right_gutter properties set a gutter on the left or right size of the bar. The gutter is space the bar can't be dragged into, that can be used for borders.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The left_gutter and right_gutter properties set a gutter on the left or right size of the bar. The gutter is space the bar can't be dragged into, that can be used for borders."

dialogos.dialogo: The bar_vertical style property displays a vertically oriented bar. All of the other properties change names - left_bar becomes top_bar, while right_bar becomes bottom_bar.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The bar_vertical style property displays a vertically oriented bar. All of the other properties change names - left_bar becomes top_bar, while right_bar becomes bottom_bar."

dialogos.dialogo: Finally, there's one style we can't show here, and it's unscrollable. It controls what happens when a scrollbar can't be moved at all.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Finally, there's one style we can't show here, and it's unscrollable. It controls what happens when a scrollbar can't be moved at all."

dialogos.dialogo: By default, it's shown. But if unscrollable is 'insensitive', the bar becomes insensitive. If it's 'hide', the bar is hidden, but still takes up space.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "By default, it's shown. But if unscrollable is 'insensitive', the bar becomes insensitive. If it's 'hide', the bar is hidden, but still takes up space."

dialogos.dialogo: That's it for the bar properties. By using them, a creator can customize bars, scrollbars, and sliders.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "That's it for the bar properties. By using them, a creator can customize bars, scrollbars, and sliders."

dialogos.dialogo: The hbox displayable is used to lay its children out horizontally. By default, there's no spacing between children, so they run together.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The hbox displayable is used to lay its children out horizontally. By default, there's no spacing between children, so they run together."

dialogos.dialogo: Similarly, the vbox displayable is used to lay its children out vertically. Both support style properties that control placement.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Similarly, the vbox displayable is used to lay its children out vertically. Both support style properties that control placement."

dialogos.dialogo: To make the size of the box displayable obvious, I'll add a highlight to the box itself, and not the frame containing it.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "To make the size of the box displayable obvious, I'll add a highlight to the box itself, and not the frame containing it."

dialogos.dialogo: Boxes support the xfill and yfill style properties. These properties make a box expand to fill the available space, rather than the space of the largest child.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Boxes support the xfill and yfill style properties. These properties make a box expand to fill the available space, rather than the space of the largest child."

dialogos.dialogo: The spacing style property takes a value in pixels, and adds that much spacing between each child of the box.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The spacing style property takes a value in pixels, and adds that much spacing between each child of the box."

dialogos.dialogo: The first_spacing style property is similar, but it only adds space between the first and second children. This is useful when the first child is a title that needs different spacing.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The first_spacing style property is similar, but it only adds space between the first and second children. This is useful when the first child is a title that needs different spacing."

dialogos.dialogo: The box_reverse style property reverses the order of entries in the box.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The box_reverse style property reverses the order of entries in the box."

dialogos.dialogo: We'll switch back to a horizontal box for our next example.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "We'll switch back to a horizontal box for our next example."

dialogos.dialogo: The box_wrap style property fills the box with children until it's full, then starts again on the next line.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The box_wrap style property fills the box with children until it's full, then starts again on the next line."

dialogos.dialogo: Grids bring with them two more style properties. The xspacing and yspacing properties control spacing in the horizontal and vertical directions, respectively.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Grids bring with them two more style properties. The xspacing and yspacing properties control spacing in the horizontal and vertical directions, respectively."

dialogos.dialogo: Lastly, we have the fixed layout. The fixed layout usually expands to fill all space, and shows its children from back to front.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Lastly, we have the fixed layout. The fixed layout usually expands to fill all space, and shows its children from back to front."

dialogos.dialogo: But of course, we have some style properties that can change that.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "But of course, we have some style properties that can change that."

dialogos.dialogo: When the xfit style property is True, the fixed lays out all its children as if it was full size, and then shrinks in width to fit them. The yfit style works the same way, but in height.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "When the xfit style property is True, the fixed lays out all its children as if it was full size, and then shrinks in width to fit them. The yfit style works the same way, but in height."

dialogos.dialogo: The order_reverse style property changes the order in which the children are shown. Instead of back-to-front, they're displayed front-to-back.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The order_reverse style property changes the order in which the children are shown. Instead of back-to-front, they're displayed front-to-back."

dialogos.dialogo: Sometimes it's hard to figure out what style is being used for a particular displayable. The displayable inspector can help with that.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Sometimes it's hard to figure out what style is being used for a particular displayable. The displayable inspector can help with that."

dialogos.dialogo: To use it, place the mouse over a portion of the Ren'Py user interface, and hit shift+I. That's I for inspector.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "To use it, place the mouse over a portion of the Ren'Py user interface, and hit shift+I. That's I for inspector."

dialogos.dialogo: Ren'Py will pop up a list of displayables the mouse is over. Next to each is the name of the style that displayable uses.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Ren'Py will pop up a list of displayables the mouse is over. Next to each is the name of the style that displayable uses."

dialogos.dialogo: You can click on the name of the style to see where it gets its properties from.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "You can click on the name of the style to see where it gets its properties from."

dialogos.dialogo: By default, the inspector only shows interface elements like screens, and not images. Type shift+alt+I if you'd like to see images as well.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "By default, the inspector only shows interface elements like screens, and not images. Type shift+alt+I if you'd like to see images as well."

dialogos.dialogo: You can try the inspector right now, by hovering this text and hitting shift+I.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "You can try the inspector right now, by hovering this text and hitting shift+I."

dialogos.dialogo: You just clicked to jump to a label.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "You just clicked to jump to a label."

dialogos.dialogo: Sometimes, when showing text, we'll want to change the way some of the text is displayed.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Sometimes, when showing text, we'll want to change the way some of the text is displayed."

dialogos.dialogo: For example, we might want to have text that is {b}bold{/b}, {i}italic{/i}, {s}struckthrough{/s}, or {u}underlined{/u}.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "For example, we might want to have text that is {b}bold{/b}, {i}italic{/i}, {s}struckthrough{/s}, or {u}underlined{/u}."

dialogos.dialogo: That's what text tags are for.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "That's what text tags are for."

dialogos.dialogo: Text tags are contained in braces, like the {{b} tag above. When a text tag takes a closing tag, the closing tag begins with a slash, like {{/b} does.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Text tags are contained in braces, like the {{b} tag above. When a text tag takes a closing tag, the closing tag begins with a slash, like {{/b} does."

dialogos.dialogo: We've already seen the b, i, s, and u tags, but there are lot more than those. I'll show you the rest of them.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "We've already seen the b, i, s, and u tags, but there are lot more than those. I'll show you the rest of them."

dialogos.dialogo: The a text tag can {a=https://www.renpy.org}link to a website{/a} or {a=jump:a_label}jump to a label{/a}.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The a text tag can {a=https://www.renpy.org}link to a website{/a} or {a=jump:a_label}jump to a label{/a}."

dialogos.dialogo: The alpha text tag makes text {alpha=.5}translucent{/alpha}.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The alpha text tag makes text {alpha=.5}translucent{/alpha}."

dialogos.dialogo: The color text tag changes the {color=#0080c0}color{/color} of the text.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The color text tag changes the {color=#0080c0}color{/color} of the text."

dialogos.dialogo: The cps text tag {cps=25}makes text type itself out slowly{/cps}, even if slow text is off.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The cps text tag {cps=25}makes text type itself out slowly{/cps}, even if slow text is off."

dialogos.dialogo: The cps tag can also be relative to the default speed, {cps=*2}doubling{/cps} or {cps=*0.5}halving{/cps} it.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The cps tag can also be relative to the default speed, {cps=*2}doubling{/cps} or {cps=*0.5}halving{/cps} it."

dialogos.dialogo: The font tag changes the font, for example to {font=DejaVuSans-Bold.ttf}DejaVuSans-Bold.ttf{/font}.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The font tag changes the font, for example to {font=DejaVuSans-Bold.ttf}DejaVuSans-Bold.ttf{/font}."

dialogos.dialogo: Sometimes, changing to a bold font looks better than using the {{b} tag.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Sometimes, changing to a bold font looks better than using the {{b} tag."

dialogos.dialogo: The k tag changes kerning. It can space the letters of a word {k=-.5}closer together{/k} or {k=.5}farther apart{/k}.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The k tag changes kerning. It can space the letters of a word {k=-.5}closer together{/k} or {k=.5}farther apart{/k}."

dialogos.dialogo: The size tag changes the size of text. It can make text {size=+10}bigger{/size} or {size=-10}smaller{/size}, or set it to a {size=30}fixed size{/size}.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The size tag changes the size of text. It can make text {size=+10}bigger{/size} or {size=-10}smaller{/size}, or set it to a {size=30}fixed size{/size}."

dialogos.dialogo: The space tag {space=30} adds horizontal space in text.{vspace=30}The vspace tag adds vertical space between lines.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The space tag {space=30} adds horizontal space in text.{vspace=30}The vspace tag adds vertical space between lines."

dialogos.dialogo: There are a few text tags that only makes sense in dialogue.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "There are a few text tags that only makes sense in dialogue."

dialogos.dialogo: The p tag breaks a paragraph,{p}and waits for the player to click.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The p tag breaks a paragraph,{p}and waits for the player to click."

dialogos.dialogo: If it is given a number as an argument,{p=1.5}it waits that many seconds.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "If it is given a number as an argument,{p=1.5}it waits that many seconds."

dialogos.dialogo: The w tag also waits for a click,{w} except it doesn't break lines,{w=.5} the way p does.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The w tag also waits for a click,{w} except it doesn't break lines,{w=.5} the way p does."

dialogos.dialogo: The nw tag causes Ren'Py to continue past slow text,{nw}
dialogos.texto_completo: eslow "The nw tag causes Ren'Py to continue past slow text,{nw}"

dialogos.dialogo: To break a line without pausing,\none can write \\n. \\' and \\\
dialogos.texto_completo: e "To break a line without pausing,\none can write \\n. \\' and \\\" include quotes in the text."

dialogos.dialogo: The interpolation feature takes a variable name in square brackets, and inserts it into text.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The interpolation feature takes a variable name in square brackets, and inserts it into text."

dialogos.dialogo: When the variable name is followed by !q, special characters are quoted. This displays the raw [variable!q!t], including the italics tags.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "When the variable name is followed by !q, special characters are quoted. This displays the raw [variable!q!t], including the italics tags."

dialogos.dialogo: When the variable name is followed by !t, it is translated to [variable!t]. It could be something else in a different language.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "When the variable name is followed by !t, it is translated to [variable!t]. It could be something else in a different language."

dialogos.dialogo: Finally, certain characters are special. [[, {{, and \\ need to be doubled if included in text. The %% character should be doubled if used in dialogue.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Finally, certain characters are special. [[, {{, and \\ need to be doubled if included in text. The %% character should be doubled if used in dialogue."

dialogos.dialogo: Ren'Py ships with a large number of built-in transitions, and also includes classes that let you define your own.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Ren'Py ships with a large number of built-in transitions, and also includes classes that let you define your own."

dialogos.dialogo: What kind of transitions would you like demonstrated?
dialogos.texto_completo: e "What kind of transitions would you like demonstrated?"

dialogos.dialogo: Okay, I can tell you about simple transitions. We call them simple because they don't take much in the way of configuration.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Okay, I can tell you about simple transitions. We call them simple because they don't take much in the way of configuration."

dialogos.dialogo: But don't let that get you down, since they're the transitions you'll probably use the most in a game.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "But don't let that get you down, since they're the transitions you'll probably use the most in a game."

dialogos.dialogo: The 'dissolve' transition is probably the most useful, blending one scene into another.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The 'dissolve' transition is probably the most useful, blending one scene into another."

dialogos.dialogo: The 'Dissolve' function lets you create your own dissolves, taking a different amount of time.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The 'Dissolve' function lets you create your own dissolves, taking a different amount of time."

dialogos.dialogo: The 'fade' transition fades to black, and then fades back in to the new scene.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The 'fade' transition fades to black, and then fades back in to the new scene."

dialogos.dialogo: If you're going to stay at a black screen, you'll probably want to use 'dissolve' rather than 'fade'.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "If you're going to stay at a black screen, you'll probably want to use 'dissolve' rather than 'fade'."

dialogos.dialogo: You can use 'Fade' to define your own fades. By changing the timing and the color faded to, you can use this for special effects, like flashbulbs.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "You can use 'Fade' to define your own fades. By changing the timing and the color faded to, you can use this for special effects, like flashbulbs."

dialogos.dialogo: The 'pixellate' transition pixellates out the old scene, switches to the new scene, and then unpixellates that.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The 'pixellate' transition pixellates out the old scene, switches to the new scene, and then unpixellates that."

dialogos.dialogo: It's probably not appropriate for most games, but we think it's kind of neat.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "It's probably not appropriate for most games, but we think it's kind of neat."

dialogos.dialogo: You can use 'Pixellate' to change the details of the pixellation.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "You can use 'Pixellate' to change the details of the pixellation."

dialogos.dialogo: Motions can also be used as transitions.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Motions can also be used as transitions."

dialogos.dialogo: I was about to demonstrate 'vpunch'... well, I guess I just did.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "I was about to demonstrate 'vpunch'... well, I guess I just did."

dialogos.dialogo: We can also shake the screen horizontally, with 'hpunch'. These were defined using the 'Move' function.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "We can also shake the screen horizontally, with 'hpunch'. These were defined using the 'Move' function."

dialogos.dialogo: There's also the 'move' transition, which is confusingly enough defined using the 'MoveTransition' function.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "There's also the 'move' transition, which is confusingly enough defined using the 'MoveTransition' function."

dialogos.dialogo: The 'move' transition finds images that have changed placement, and slides them to their new place. It's an easy way to get motion in your game.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The 'move' transition finds images that have changed placement, and slides them to their new place. It's an easy way to get motion in your game."

dialogos.dialogo: That's it for the simple transitions.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "That's it for the simple transitions."

dialogos.dialogo: Perhaps the most flexible kind of transition is the ImageDissolve, which lets you use an image to control a dissolve.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Perhaps the most flexible kind of transition is the ImageDissolve, which lets you use an image to control a dissolve."

dialogos.dialogo: This lets us specify very complex transitions, fairly simply. Let's try some, and then I'll show you how they work.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "This lets us specify very complex transitions, fairly simply. Let's try some, and then I'll show you how they work."

dialogos.dialogo: There are two ImageDissolve transitions built into Ren'Py.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "There are two ImageDissolve transitions built into Ren'Py."

dialogos.dialogo: The 'blinds' transition opens and closes what looks like vertical blinds.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The 'blinds' transition opens and closes what looks like vertical blinds."

dialogos.dialogo: The 'squares' transition uses these squares to show things.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The 'squares' transition uses these squares to show things."

dialogos.dialogo: I'm not sure why anyone would want to use it, but it was used in some translated games, so we added it.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "I'm not sure why anyone would want to use it, but it was used in some translated games, so we added it."

dialogos.dialogo: The most interesting transitions aren't in the standard library.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The most interesting transitions aren't in the standard library."

dialogos.dialogo: These ones require an image the size of the screen, and so we couldn't include them as the size of the screen can change from game to game.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "These ones require an image the size of the screen, and so we couldn't include them as the size of the screen can change from game to game."

dialogos.dialogo: We can hide things with a 'circleirisin'...
dialogos.texto_completo: e "We can hide things with a 'circleirisin'..."

dialogos.dialogo: ... and show them again with a 'circleirisout'.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "... and show them again with a 'circleirisout'."

dialogos.dialogo: The 'circlewipe' transitions changes screens using a circular wipe effect.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The 'circlewipe' transitions changes screens using a circular wipe effect."

dialogos.dialogo: The 'dream' transition does this weird wavy dissolve, and does it relatively slowly.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The 'dream' transition does this weird wavy dissolve, and does it relatively slowly."

dialogos.dialogo: The 'teleport' transition reveals the new scene one line at a time.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The 'teleport' transition reveals the new scene one line at a time."

dialogos.dialogo: This is the background picture used with the circleirisout transition.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "This is the background picture used with the circleirisout transition."

dialogos.dialogo: When we use an ImageDissolve, the white will dissolve in first, followed by progressively darker colors. Let's try it.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "When we use an ImageDissolve, the white will dissolve in first, followed by progressively darker colors. Let's try it."

dialogos.dialogo: If we give ImageDissolve the 'reverse' parameter, black areas will dissolve in first.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "If we give ImageDissolve the 'reverse' parameter, black areas will dissolve in first."

dialogos.dialogo: This lets circleirisin and circleirisout use the same image.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "This lets circleirisin and circleirisout use the same image."

dialogos.dialogo: The teleport transition uses a different image, one that dissolves things in one line at a time.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The teleport transition uses a different image, one that dissolves things in one line at a time."

dialogos.dialogo: A dissolve only seems to affect parts of the scene that have changed...
dialogos.texto_completo: e "A dissolve only seems to affect parts of the scene that have changed..."

dialogos.dialogo: ... which is how we apply the teleport effect to a single character.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "... which is how we apply the teleport effect to a single character."

dialogos.dialogo: The CropMove transition class provides a wide range of transition effects. It's not used very much in practice, though.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The CropMove transition class provides a wide range of transition effects. It's not used very much in practice, though."

dialogos.dialogo: I'll stand offscreen, so you can see some of its modes. I'll read out the mode name after each transition.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "I'll stand offscreen, so you can see some of its modes. I'll read out the mode name after each transition."

dialogos.dialogo: While the slide transitions slide in the new scene, the slideaways slide out the old scene.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "While the slide transitions slide in the new scene, the slideaways slide out the old scene."

dialogos.dialogo: We also have a couple of transitions that use a rectangular iris.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "We also have a couple of transitions that use a rectangular iris."

dialogos.dialogo: It's enough to make you feel a bit dizzy.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "It's enough to make you feel a bit dizzy."

dialogos.dialogo: The PushMove transitions use the new scene to push the old one out. Let's take a look.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The PushMove transitions use the new scene to push the old one out. Let's take a look."

dialogos.dialogo: ... and pushup. And that's it the for the PushMove-based transitions.
dialogos.texto_completo: "... and pushup. And that's it the for the PushMove-based transitions."

dialogos.dialogo: The most common MoveTransition is move, which slides around images that have changed position on the screen.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The most common MoveTransition is move, which slides around images that have changed position on the screen."

dialogos.dialogo: There are also the moveout and movein transitions.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "There are also the moveout and movein transitions."

dialogos.dialogo: The moveout transitions (moveoutleft, moveoutright, moveouttop, and moveoutbottom) slide hidden images off the appropriate side of the screen.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The moveout transitions (moveoutleft, moveoutright, moveouttop, and moveoutbottom) slide hidden images off the appropriate side of the screen."

dialogos.dialogo: The movein transitions (moveinleft, moveinright, moveintop, and moveinbottom) slide in new images.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The movein transitions (moveinleft, moveinright, moveintop, and moveinbottom) slide in new images."

dialogos.dialogo: Let's see them all in action.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Let's see them all in action."

dialogos.dialogo: That's it for the moveins and moveouts.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "That's it for the moveins and moveouts."

dialogos.dialogo: Finally, there are the zoomin and zoomout transitions, which show and hide things using a zoom.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Finally, there are the zoomin and zoomout transitions, which show and hide things using a zoom."

dialogos.dialogo: The AlphaDissolve transition lets you use one displayable to combine two others. Click, and I'll show you an example.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The AlphaDissolve transition lets you use one displayable to combine two others. Click, and I'll show you an example."

dialogos.dialogo: The AlphaDissolve displayable takes a control displayable, usually an ATL transform.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The AlphaDissolve displayable takes a control displayable, usually an ATL transform."

dialogos.dialogo: To be useful, the control displayable should be partially transparent.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "To be useful, the control displayable should be partially transparent."

dialogos.dialogo: During an AlphaDissolve, the old screen is used to fill the transparent areas of the image, while the new screen fills the opaque areas.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "During an AlphaDissolve, the old screen is used to fill the transparent areas of the image, while the new screen fills the opaque areas."

dialogos.dialogo: For our spotlight example, the old screen is this all-black image.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "For our spotlight example, the old screen is this all-black image."

dialogos.dialogo: The new screen is me just standing here.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The new screen is me just standing here."

dialogos.dialogo: By combining them using AlphaDissolve, we can build a complicated effect out of simpler parts.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "By combining them using AlphaDissolve, we can build a complicated effect out of simpler parts."

dialogos.dialogo: Ren'Py includes support for translating your game into languages other than the one it was originally written in.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Ren'Py includes support for translating your game into languages other than the one it was originally written in."

dialogos.dialogo: This includes the translation of every string in the game, including dialogue, menu choice, and interface strings, and of images and other assets.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "This includes the translation of every string in the game, including dialogue, menu choice, and interface strings, and of images and other assets."

dialogos.dialogo: While Ren'Py can find dialogue and menu choice strings for you, you'll have to indicate which other strings need translation.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "While Ren'Py can find dialogue and menu choice strings for you, you'll have to indicate which other strings need translation."

dialogos.dialogo: For example, here is how we define a character and her name.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "For example, here is how we define a character and her name."

dialogos.dialogo: To mark Lucy's name as translatable, we surround it by parentheses preceded by a single underscore.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "To mark Lucy's name as translatable, we surround it by parentheses preceded by a single underscore."

dialogos.dialogo: Notice how we don't translate the reddish color that we use for her name. That stays the same for all languages.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Notice how we don't translate the reddish color that we use for her name. That stays the same for all languages."

dialogos.dialogo: Once that's done, you can generate the translation files. That's done by going to the launcher, and clicking translate.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Once that's done, you can generate the translation files. That's done by going to the launcher, and clicking translate."

dialogos.dialogo: After you type in the name of the language you'll be translating to, choosing Generate Translations will scan your game and create translation files.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "After you type in the name of the language you'll be translating to, choosing Generate Translations will scan your game and create translation files."

dialogos.dialogo: The files will be generated in game/tl/language, where language is the name of the language you typed in.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The files will be generated in game/tl/language, where language is the name of the language you typed in."

dialogos.dialogo: You'll need to edit those files to include translations for everything in your game.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "You'll need to edit those files to include translations for everything in your game."

dialogos.dialogo: If you want to localize image files, you can also place them in game/tl/language.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "If you want to localize image files, you can also place them in game/tl/language."

dialogos.dialogo: If the default fonts used by the game do not support the language you are translating to, you will have to change them.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "If the default fonts used by the game do not support the language you are translating to, you will have to change them."

dialogos.dialogo: The translate python statement can be used to set the values of gui variables to change the font.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The translate python statement can be used to set the values of gui variables to change the font."

dialogos.dialogo: The translate style statement sets style properties more directly.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "The translate style statement sets style properties more directly."

dialogos.dialogo: If you need to add new files, such as font files, you can place them into the game/tl/language directory where Ren'Py will find them.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "If you need to add new files, such as font files, you can place them into the game/tl/language directory where Ren'Py will find them."

dialogos.dialogo: Finally, you'll have to add support for picking the language of the game. That usually goes into the preferences screen, found in screens.rpy.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Finally, you'll have to add support for picking the language of the game. That usually goes into the preferences screen, found in screens.rpy."

dialogos.dialogo: Here's an excerpt of the preferences screen of this tutorial. The Language action tells Ren'Py to change the language. It takes a string giving a language name, or None.

dialogos.dialogo: Hi! My name is Eileen, and I'd like to welcome you to the Ren'Py tutorial.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "Hi! My name is Eileen, and I'd like to welcome you to the Ren'Py tutorial."

dialogos.dialogo: In this tutorial, we'll teach you the basics of Ren'Py, so you can make games of your own. We'll also demonstrate many features, so you can see what Ren'Py is capable of.
dialogos.texto_completo: e "In this tutorial, we'll teach you the basics of Ren'Py, so you can make games of your own. We'll also demonstrate many features, so you can see what Ren'Py is capable of."
